CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 10, 1963, pg. 15 reads: "50 Years Of Service - Mrs. Ida B. Martin (third from right), state supervisor for the Churches of God in Christ, was awarded the Doctor of Humanities degree by the American Bible College of Chicago, for 50 years of religious service. Left to right: Dr. Jefferson D. Myers, associate Bishop of Western Pennsylvania; Dr. George Hyatt, dean of the American Bible College, who made the presentation; Bishop G.E. Vaughn, state Bishop; the honoree; Bishop O.T. Jones of Philadelphia and Dr. Arenia C. Mallory, president of Saints Industrial and Junior College, Lexington, Miss. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, from left: Dr. Jefferson D. Myers, Dr. George Hyatt, Bishop G.E. Vaughn, Ida Martin, honoree awarded the Doctor of Humanities degree by the American Bible College of Chicago; Bishop O.T. Jones, and Dr. Arenia C. Mallory, standing behind banquet table in interior with block wall and clock reading "9:37"
